business.headline: Sensex crashes 1,200 points, Nifty falls below 24,000; IT stocks tumbleAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex ended 1190.34 points lower at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 to settle below 24,000.

Renewable energy stocks could make your portfolio green. 5 reasons whyWith the global shift towards clean energy, renewable energy stocks have proven to be rewarding for many, delivering strong returns.

Infosys, LTIM, HCLTech, TCS: Why IT stocks are tumbling todayInfosys led the decline with a 3% drop, while Tech Mahindra and LTIMindtree were down by 2.5%. HCLTech, MPhasis, and TCS also recorded losses exceeding 2%.

How this firm is blending sustainability in India's alcohol industryThe company's innovative approach, dubbed 'Grain to Glass', is transforming how businesses can contribute to environmental and social development.

Explained: Why newly-listed NTPC Green Energy shares gained 5% todayNTPC Green Energy share price: The latest surge follows NTPC Green Energy's announcement regarding the commercial operation of the first phase of its Shajapur Solar Project in Madhya Pradesh.

Suraksha Diagnostic IPO opens tomorrow: Check price band, issue size, GMPSuraksha Diagnostic IPO: The IPO will open for bidding on Friday and is expected to list on the stock exchanges on December 6, 2024.

Ola Electric shares continue positive rally, rise above Rs 90. Time to buy?Ola Electric share price: With this, the stock has gained over 35% in the last five sessions and has surpassed the Rs 90 target set by Citi on November 26.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: 4 reasons why Sensex plunged 1,200 points todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1190.34 points at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 points to 23,914.15.
Explained: Why LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade  LIC Stock Price: LIC share price gained nearly 4% in early trade despite a sharp drop in the benchmark stock market indices.

SpiceJet share price rises after Aircastle drops insolvency caseIn September, SpiceJet announced the resolution of a $23.39 million dispute with Aircastle (Ireland) Designated Activity Company and Wilmington Trust SP Services (Dublin) Limited.

Adani Total Gas share price jumps 16% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Total Gas share price: The stock touched an intraday high of Rs 823.30 before settling at Rs 787, up 13.36% at 10:51 am.

Adani group stocks extend winning streak, rally up to 12% todayAdani Group stocks such as Adani Green Energy Ltd, Adani Power Ltd, Adani Energy Solutions Ltd, and Adani Enterprises Ltd gained as much as 12% after the recent clarification on the US bribery charges.
Sensex, Nifty open flat; Adani group shares gain up to 10% in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 17.08 points to 80,217.00, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 8.05 points to 24,282.95.

Enviro Infra Engineers listing: Does latest GMP signal a strong market debut? Enviro Infra Engineers listing: The initial public offering (IPO) of Enviro Infra Engineers saw strong investor interest through its 3-day bidding process as it was oversubscribed by 89.90 times.

Stocks to watch today: Adani, Waaree, PCBL, Vedanta, Godrej Properties Stocks to watch: In today's trade, shares of Adani Group, Waaree Renewable Technologies, Godrej Properties, Vedanta, and PCBL, among others, will be in focus due to various developments.

This is a hatchet job: Mahesh Jethmalani on Adani's US indictmentIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, senior advocate and former BJP Rajya Sabha MP Mahesh Jatmalani defended Gautam Adani and called the US indictment a 'hatchet job'.

Adani shares rally after clarification on US bribery charges. Is the worst over? Adani Power shares closed 20% higher at Rs 525.30, Adani Total Gas gained 19.76% to Rs 694.25, and Adani Enterprises rose 11.56% to Rs 2,398.35. These were the top gainers among all the listed Adani Group companies.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as Adani stocks rally up to 20% The S&P BSE Sensex added 230.02 points to close at 80,234.08, while the NSE NIfty50 gained 82.20 points to end at 24,276.70.

HDFC Life faces cyberattack: Fraudsters steal customer data, demand extortionThe breach occurred between November 19 and November 21, 2024 and the cybercriminals managed to steal personal information about HDFC Life's customers.

Ola Electric share price jumps 18%: Should you buy now or wait?The rally in Ola Electric shares followed the company's announcement of its new electric scooter lineup, which aims to make EVs more accessible across various segments.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Supreme Court takes note of India Today report exposing stubble-burning eyewashThe court recorded that officials cannot permit farmers to burn stubble, and instructed the Punjab government to issue immediate instructions to prevent such practices.

Mahayuti huddle on new Maharashtra Chief Minister shortly as leaders reach DelhiA key meeting of Mahayuti leaders -- Devendra Fadnavis, Ajit Pawar and Eknath Shinde -- with BJP leadership is scheduled to take place shortly at Union Home Minister Amit Shah's residence in the capital city.

Sheikh Hasina slams Hindu monk's arrest in Bangladesh: Anarchist activitiesSheikh Hasina, who fled to India following violent student protests in August, condemned the arrest of Chinmoy Krishna Das and demanded his immediate release. She also flagged attacks on mosques, shrines, churches in recent months.

Who's eyeing what as Mahayuti government takes shape in Maharashtra Mahayuti allies will meet Amit Shah in Delhi today as BJP, Shiv Sena (Shinde faction), and Ajit Pawar-led NCP vie for critical portfolios in Maharashtra's cabinet reshuffle.

Picture of woman commando next to PM Modi goes viral. What we knowAn image of a woman commando next to Prime Minister Narendra Modi has gone viral. With many speculating that the woman commando is a part of SPG (Special Protection Group), the identity of the woman officer, along with her branch of service, remains unknown.

Australia imposes social media ban for children under 16 in a world-first lawThe law forces tech giants from Instagram and Facebook owner Meta to TikTok to stop minors logging in or face fines of up to A$49.5 million (USD32 million).

Hemant Soren takes oath as Jharkhand Chief Minister at star-studded INDIA showThe ceremony was attended by several leaders, including Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin, and Bihar's Leader of Opposition Tejashwi Yadav, among others.

Bloodbath on Dalal Street: 4 reasons why Sensex plunged 1,200 points todayAt the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1190.34 points at 79,043.74, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 360.75 points to 23,914.15.

Was Ajmer Dargah a Shiva temple? What books, Hindu petitioner's evidence suggestA court in Rajasthan's Ajmer has issued notices to several authorities on a petition seeking a physical survey of Ajmer Dargah. The petitioner cited a book to say that the Ajmer Dargah was originally a Shiva temple. What does the book and other documents on the dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti suggest?

Watch: Virat Kohli, Australian PM engage in 'spicy' banter over Perth TestBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese praised Jasprit Bumrah and Virat Kohli for their match-winning efforts in the Perth Test. PM Anthony hosted the Indian team at the Parliament House in Canberra on Thursday, November 28.

Use of Punjabi for sex assaults in Canada helps police nab Indian-origin suspectPeel Police cracked three cases of sexual assault within a week and arrested an Indian-origin man, Arshdeep Singh, for the crime in Brampton, Canada. What helped police crack the case was the use of Punjabi by the 22-year-old, who posed as a cab driver, to lure the women into his vehicle.

Supriya Sule's audio clip was manipulated, expert analysis suggestsEarlier, a preliminary investigation by India Today, using three publicly available tools, had raised doubts about the authenticity of the clips allegedly involving NCP (SP) leader Supriya Sule.

Bangladesh's responsibility to protect life of minorities: Centre to ParliamentThe MEA's statement in Parliament comes amid a fresh wave of unrest in Bangladesh over the arrest of a Hindu leader and the targeting of temples by radical Islamic outfits.

Sambhal violence: Audio clip reveals how more people were mobilised with armsSambhal violence: The investigation team recovered the audio clip from mobile phones that were seized from the suspects. In the clip, an unidentified person can be heard giving a call for more people to be mobilised near the Shahi Jama Masjid.

Bengaluru woman says flatmates rejected her for being 20 during house hunt. VideoThe Bengaluru woman narrated how she was keen on moving into the apartment and had been in touch with the flatmates, only to be turned down after visiting the house.

Trekking in Himachal's Dhauladhar range temporarily bannedExtra personnel will be deployed by the SP's office to assess weather forecasts from the Meteorological Department in Shimla before granting any permissions for trekking.

Why Chandrababu Naidu is wary of calling off Andhra-Adani solar power dealPower generation and private investment compulsions are greater at the moment than making political capital by cornering predecessor Jagan Reddy in the alleged $250 million scam

S Jaishankar meets PM in Parliament, briefs him on Bangladesh violence: SourcesThe meeting comes amid spiralling violence against Hindus in Bangladesh. The minority community has faced more than 200 attacks since the fall of Sheikh Hasina's Awami League government on August 5.

Think vaping is healthier than smoking? It affects sperm count, damages heartVaping, perceived as a safer smoking alternative, is rising globally, including in India. However, recent studies reveal it can harm vascular health even without nicotine.

What sunk Sharad Pawar's NCP? Independents blowing their own 'trumpet'Contestants with the 'trumpet' symbol—closely resembling the NCP (SCP)'s 'tutari'—secured crucial votes in seats that Pawar's party lost narrowly in the Maharashtra polls

Isro to launch India's first AI laboratory to space aboard PSLV-XL Scheduled for December 4, the mission will be launched aboard the PSLV rocket, aiming to revolutionise space research by enabling real-time data processing in orbit.

Hyundai Creta EV launch in India at Bharat Mobility 2025The Hyundai Creta EV will rival the Mahindra BE 6e, Tata Curvv EV, MG ZS EV, and the upcoming Maruti Suzuki e Vitara, which is based on the Maruti Suzuki eVX concept.

At Emmys, Vir Das pun on Elon Musk in Trump 2.0: Self-driving but I have controlComedian Vir Das shared his International Emmy's opening monologue on social media. He scripted history by being the first Indian to host the ceremony.

Moana 2 review: Stunning visuals, but lacks the heart and charm of the originalReleased-Fri Nov 29, 2024Moana 2 movie review: Moana 2 enchants with its stunning visuals but struggles to match the heart and musical brilliance of its predecessor.

Alia Bhatt, Soni Razdan's sweetest birthday wish for Shaheen BhattAlia Bhatt's older sister, Shaheen Bhatt, celebrated her birthday on November 28. Alia and her mother, Soni Razdan, shared heartfelt birthday wishes for her.

Fan requests Diljit Dosanjh for tickets to Kolkata show, singer respondsA fan requested Diljit Dosanjh for tickets to his upcoming Kolkata concert. The singer, who is set to perform in the city on November 30, responded on X.

Allu Arjun joins anti-drug awareness drive, urges support for victimsAhead of the grand release of Pushpa 2: The Rule, Allu Arjun steps into a new role. He lent his voice to Telangana's anti-drug awareness campaign, urging help for victims.

NaaNaa Hyraanaa: Ram Charan, Kiara's Game Changer new song is a soulful melodyNaaNaa Hyraanaa, the new song from Ram Charan and Kiara Advani's Game Changer, was released. The soulful track has been sung by Shreya Ghoshal and Karthik.

sports.headline: South Africa in cruise control of Durban Test after Sri Lanka 42 all-outMarco Jansen's career-best 7/13 dismantled Sri Lanka for a record-low 42 runs, giving South Africa a dominant position in the Durban Test. The Proteas' fiery bowling and solid batting combined to crush Sri Lanka's hopes of a comeback.

Iga Swiatek breaks silence on 1-month doping ban: Worst experience of my lifeFormer World No.1 Iga Swiatek has opened up on the one-month doping ban she has accepted on Thursday, November 28, calling it the worst experience of her life. Swiatek accepted the ban after unknowingly consuming a banned substance.

IPL mega auction review: Did RCB get it right this time?IPL mega auction review: Royal Challengers Bengaluru faced the stick for missing out on big buys, but it seems it was a conscious choice as they resisted the temptation of spending big on Day 1. Under Andy Flower and Dinesh Karthik, RCB made some smart buys throughout the two-day auction, impressing their fans. Barring the Will Jacks controversy, RCB did alright.

Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Are Australia afraid of Jasprit Bumrah? India landed a stinging first punch in Perth, beginning the five-Test Border-Gavaskar Trophy on a high. India hammered Australia by 295 runs, handing the hosts their first-ever loss at the Optus Stadium in Perth. In the latest episode of the Sledging Room Podcast, we discuss the sweet start to the five-Test series.

India should target FIFA Top 50 Rankings: Sports Minister sets high-targetIndia aims for a FIFA top 50 ranking in 10 years with grassroots football initiatives, including new academies and a focus on nurturing young talent. Collaborative efforts between AIFF and the Sports Ministry promise long-term development for Indian football.

Kamran Ghulam 103 inspires Pakistan's come-from-behind ODI series winZimbabwe vs Pakistan, 3rd ODI: Pakistan completed a come-from-behind series win, hammering Zimbabwe by 99 runs in the series finale. Kamran Ghulam's hundred and an all-round bowling attack helped Pakistan seal the series win on Friday,

Syed Modi International: PV Sindhu survives scare, Lakshya breezes into quartersPV Sindhu battled hard to overcome fellow Indian Ira Sharma in a three-game match to reach the Syed Modi International quarterfinals. Lakshya Sen breezed into the final 8 stage with a straight games win.

Etihad Airways unveils CSK-themed livery on Airbus A320neoEtihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, has unveiled a new livery inspired by its partnership with Chennai Super Kings.

Tennis star Iga Swiatek accepts one-month ban for failed dope test World No. 2 women's singles player Iga Swiatek accepted a one-match ban after a failed doping test in August 2024. The five-time Grand Slam champion tested positive for a prohibited substance -- trimetazidine.

U-19 Asia Cup 2024: Schedule, livestreaming and all you need to knowAsia's finest youngsters will be on show as the U-19 Asia Cup 2024 starts from Friday, November 29. India's young sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi will be one of the stars on display during the tournament.

Pacer Siddarth Kaul announces retirement: Time to call time on my career in IndiaFast bowler Siddarth Kaul announced his retirement from all forms of cricket, days after he went unsold in the IPL 2025 auction. Siddarth played a key role in India's U19 World Cup triumph in 2008 and went on to play 6 matches for India.

Siddarth played a key role in India's U19 World Cup triumph in 2008 and went on to play 6 matches for India.

SL vs AUS: Adam Zampa eager to make Test debut for Australia in Sri Lanka tourAdam Zampa is pushing to make his Test debut during Australia's tour of Sri Lanka in late January 2025. The Sri Lanka tour could be the last chance Zampa will get to represent Australia in the Test arena.

PM Narendra Modi 'strongly rooting' for India to win series in Australia Prime Minister Narendra Modi backed the Indian Cricket Team to beat Australia in the ongoing five-match Test series between the two countries.

Pep Guardiola on 'red alert' at Manchester City: Decoding club's strugglesManchester City's dominance has hit a shocking roadblock, with Pep Guardiola enduring his longest winless streak as a manager. Six games without victory have raised questions about injuries, tactical missteps, and the team's reliance on key players like Rodri.

Fully support Pakistan's stance on Champions Trophy hybrid model: Shahid AfridiShahid Afridi has offered his full support to Pakistan's stance of not accepting the hybrid model for the ICC Champions Trophy 2025. The tournament has been in limbo due to India's reluctance to travel to Pakistan for the tournament.

After IPL pay rise, Marco Jansen rattles Sri Lanka with career-best Test figuresSouth Africa vs Sri Lanka: Marco Jansen registered the joint second-best figures for a South African fast bowler in Tests. Jansen's 7 for 13 saw Sri Lanka getting bowled out for 42 on Thursday in Durban.

AUS vs IND: Virat Kohli in Australia team? Cummins, Maxwell and Head answerVirat Kohli seems to have a lot of fans in the Australia camp as he Indian star was picked by many as a dream player to be in their squad. Kohli scored a fine hundred against Australia in the Perth Test.

SA vs SL: Sri Lanka bowled out for 42, their lowest score in Test cricketSri Lanka got bundled out for their lowest score in the history of Test cricket as they got all out for 42 on Day 2 of the first Test against South Africa in Durban.

If not Virat Kohli then who? Assessing RCB's captaincy options after auctionIPL 2025 mega auction: Suspense remains over RCB's captaincy duties for the upcoming season. Let's figure out who could be the potential captaincy pick for RCB barring Virat Kohli.

Prithvi Shaw's old coach reveals major difference between him and Yashasvi JaiswalPrithvi Shaw's old coach Jwala Singh recently revealed the major point of difference between him and India's rising star Yashasvi Jaiswal.

Fakhar Zaman in line for Pakistan team return during South Africa tourFakhar Zaman is in line to make a return to the Pakistan team for the white-ball tour of South Africa, according to the latest reports. Fakhar was dropped from the tour of Australia due to fitness issues.

Get him in: Ian Healy wants Australia to hand Beau Webster debut in AdelaideFormer wicketkeeper Ian Healy has said that Australia should hand Beau Webster his debut after the all-rounder was added to the squad for the Adelaide Test. Webster has been a consistent performer on the domestic circuit.

Bhuvneshwar Kumar pens 'goodbye' message to SRH after expensive RCB switchBhuvneshwar Kumar bids farewell to Sunrisers Hyderabad after 11 years, joining Royal Challengers Bangalore for a record-breaking Rs 10.75 crore in the IPL 2025 auction, marking a new chapter in his illustrious career.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
